summary: The AHNet class defines a deep neural network architecture for medical image segmentation, supporting both 2D and 3D inputs. It builds a series of residual blocks, optionally incorporates a pyramid pooling module, and uses configurable upsampling methods (transpose convolution, bilinear, trilinear, or nearest neighbor) to reconstruct the output resolution. The network also includes functionality to initialize its weights from a pretrained ResNet50 model and enforces input size constraints for compatibility.
business_intent: Provide a flexible, highâ€‘performance segmentation model for medical imaging applications, allowing researchers and clinicians to leverage a robust architecture with optional pretrained weights and customizable upsampling strategies for accurate and efficient analysis of volumetric data.
